metadata.synopsis: You find Astarion shirtless, tracing the scars on his back with his fingers, trying to read what they say through touch. Initially startled and a little embarrassed, he'll open up to anyone he thinks he can trust. An intimate moment, where he'll let characters with a high approval rating try to read what his scars say, or at least trace them into the dirt for him to read.

140.speaker: Astarion
140.text: A line with a fork and one - two - three dots?
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing away from you, trying to trace runes on his back with his fingers.InternalNodeContext: Astarion found out it was Infernal during the romance sceneNodeContext: Facing away from you, trying to trace runes on his back with his fingers.

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: Bloody Infernal - how is anyone meant to read this garbage?
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing away from you.NodeContext: Facing away from you.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: It's easy for some of us.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Offering to help. I can tell you what it says, if you want.

217.speaker: Astarion
217.text: I am perfectly capable, thank you. This isn't your concern.

57.speaker: Player
57.context: NodeContext: Just been told that what's on his back might be dangerous.

160.speaker: Player
160.context: NodeContext: Just been told that what's on his back might be dangerous.

173.speaker: Astarion
173.text: Well find something else to gawp at. I'm busy and I don't need your help.
173.context: NodeContext: Just been told that what's on his back might be dangerous.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: The little I read looked pretty dangerous, but if you don't want to know...
211.context: NodeContext: Just been told that what's on his back might be dangerous.

97.text: What? I - well, maybe you could have a look.
97.context: NodeContext: Just been told that what's on his back might be dangerous.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: What? I - well, maybe you could have a look.
12.context: NodeContext: Just been told that what's on his back might be dangerous.

28.text: *The jagged script is definitely Infernal, the language of the Hells, but you can't make out its meaning.*
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

170.speaker: Narrator
170.text: *The jagged script is definitely Infernal, the language of the Hells, but you can't make out its meaning.*
170.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *The jagged script is definitely Infernal, a language you know all too well.*
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

157.speaker: Narrator
157.text: *The lines describe oaths and 'the fires below', but the language is fragmented and strange. This is just a piece of a larger text.*

172.speaker: Narrator
172.text: *You run your eyes over the runes hacked into his flesh and recognise an all-too-familiar language: Infernal. It's the language of the Hells.*
172.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *You can't read the text carved into his flesh, but you recognise the script - any warlock would. It's Infernal, the language of the Hells.*
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

189.speaker: Astarion
189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

234.speaker: Player
234.text: Something about 'the fires below'? It's just fragments of Infernal legalese.
234.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

202.speaker: Player
202.text: It's not a poem. It might be part of a devil's pact...
202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

233.speaker: Astarion
233.text: An infernal pact? But not even the whole text?
233.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

207.speaker: Astarion
207.text: What was that bastard up to?
207.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

132.text: If he did make a devil's pact, he's more dangerous than we thought.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: If he did make a devil's pact, he's more dangerous than we thought.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: More dangerous than you thought, perhaps. I've never had any doubt.

128.speaker: Astarion
128.text: But if Cazador drew up a contract with someone in the Hells, then we need details from Raphael. There must be immense power on the line.

243.speaker: Astarion
243.text: But if this is part of a contract, it must be powerful. Or valuable. Or both.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Does it matter? You're free of him now.

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: It matters! It's carved into my back - whatever this is, it's part of me.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: No wonder he wants me back. What have I run off with...

177.speaker: Astarion
177.text: What have I run off with...

40.speaker: Player
40.text: We should tell the others. They might be able to help.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: It's written in Infernal, I can't read it.
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: You grab a stick and draw a copy of the 'poem' into the dirt.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: Infernal? Are you sure? Can you show me?
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: You grab a stick and draw a copy of the 'poem' into the dirt.

154.context: CinematicNodeContext: You grab a stick and draw a copy of the 'poem' into the dirt.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning to look at the symbols you've drawn on the groundNodeContext: Turning to look at the symbols you've drawn on the ground

148.text: What did he do to me?
148.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: What did he do to me?
58.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

150.speaker: Player
150.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

227.speaker: Astarion
227.text: I have absolutely no idea. But it's no poem.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Should we ask the others? They might know something.
67.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: No! No, let's keep this between ourselves. At least until we know what it means.
71.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

183.speaker: Astarion
183.text: Two centuries carrying this, and I can finally see it.
183.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

116.text: You really have no idea what this is?
116.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

206.speaker: Player
206.text: You really have no idea what this is?
206.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: It doesn't look like a poem. It doesn't look like anything I recognise.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: If anyone can tell us, Raphael can.
85.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: I'm sure he can. A shame it took a deal with a devil to unravel this.

115.speaker: Astarion
115.text: Still, I've made my bed with Raphael. We'll know soon enough.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Whatever you find, you don't have to deal with it alone.

259.speaker: Astarion
259.text: Thank you. It never really occurred to me to ask for help, and - well...

200.speaker: Astarion
200.text: I suppose 'thank you' covered it, really. But I do mean it. I'm grateful - for all of this.

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: When Cazador first carved this on me, I didn't fight back. I couldn't. I just knelt there as it happened to me.

253.speaker: Astarion
253.text: But now that I'm free of him, now that I have a choice, I will do whatever it takes to fight. I'll pay any price to undo what he did to me.

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: Thank you, by the way. This may not be your fight exactly, but you're willing to help. That means a lot.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Did you ever see Cazador write in Infernal before?
3.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

210.speaker: Astarion
210.text: No. I could have missed it, of course, but I doubt it.
210.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

141.speaker: Astarion
141.text: Cazador was only figuratively hellish - there were never any devils hanging about the crypt.
141.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

185.speaker: Astarion
185.text: Whatever he's left carved in my flesh, it's a mystery to me.
185.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

213.speaker: Astarion
213.text: Thank you, by the way. This is... well, it's something.
213.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

91.speaker: Player
91.text: We'll figure it out. I promise.
91.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is being hopelessly nieve

240.speaker: Astarion
240.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is being hopelessly nieve

153.speaker: Astarion
153.text: Given the subject matter, I probably won't.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Just make sure it doesn't get us killed, all right?

212.speaker: Player
212.text: Someone out there will be able to read it, I'm sure.

179.speaker: Astarion
179.text: I'm sure, but what will it say?

21.speaker: Player
21.text: If this is part of a contract, where's the rest?

104.speaker: Astarion
104.text: I wasn't his only spawn. And he tortured us all - I imagine each of us are carrying a piece of this infernal contract.

180.speaker: Astarion
180.text: But what could a devil have offered Cazador? He had wealth, power, control - what more could you want?

208.speaker: Astarion
208.text: Perplexed. This was a surprise, and Cazador's surprises are never good.

161.speaker: Astarion
161.text: Then again, even he couldn't know I'd be kidnapped. Whatever he planned, it's gone wrong. Which gives us an advantage.

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: If it's a poem at all...

250.speaker: Player
250.text: What does it matter? You're free of him now.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: *The pattern swirls before you, runes hacked crudely into his flesh. You can't read it, but you recognise the letters: Infernal, the language of the Hells.*

167.speaker: Player
167.text: *The pattern swirls before you, runes hacked crudely into his flesh. You can't read it, but you recognise the letters: Infernal, the language of the Hells.*

94.text: *The pattern swirls before you, runes hacked crudely into his flesh. You can't read it, but you recognise the letters: Infernal, the language of the Hells.*

260.speaker: Narrator
260.text: *The pattern swirls before you, runes hacked crudely into his flesh. You can't read it, but you recognise the letters: Infernal, the language of the Hells.*

6.text: *The runes are carved in deep, brutal strokes, but the jagged letters mean nothing to you. Whatever language this is, you don't recognise it.*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *The runes are carved in deep, brutal strokes, but the jagged letters mean nothing to you. Whatever language this is, you don't recognise it.*

246.speaker: Player
246.text: I'm not sure. Hold still, I'll draw it for you.

223.speaker: Player
223.text: Nothing. It's just a bunch of strange symbols.

216.speaker: Astarion
216.text: It's not a poem? That can't be good.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: What are these symbols? There must be something you can tell me about them?

166.speaker: Player
166.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back to face the playerNodeContext: Turns back to face the player

78.text: What is it, if not a poem?

171.speaker: Player
171.text: What is it, if not a poem?

121.speaker: Astarion
121.text: It's a surprise. And Cazador's surprises are never good.

39.text: *You search for anything you recognise - a letter, a rune, something - but there's nothing. You can't even tell what script it's written in.*

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *You search for anything you recognise - a letter, a rune, something - but there's nothing. You can't even tell what script it's written in.*

1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back to face the playerNodeContext: Turns back to face the player

247.text: Useless. Why do I even bother with you?
247.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back to face the playerNodeContext: Turns back to face the player

87.speaker: Astarion
87.text: Useless. Why do I even bother with you?
87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back to face the playerNodeContext: Turns back to face the player

118.speaker: Astarion
118.text: At least I still have the devil. He'll deliver, even if it's at a price.

168.speaker: Astarion
168.text: I thought you could help me, but no - I'll have to make my own way. As usual.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: 'There once was a cleric of Gond, who was cursed with a very small wand...'
75.context: NodeContext: quickly running out of patience

244.speaker: Astarion
244.context: NodeContext: quickly running out of patience

146.speaker: Astarion
146.text: You sweetheart. But while you're here, maybe there's something else you could look at?

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Want me to take a look?
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised, snapping his words.

197.speaker: Astarion
197.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised, snapping his words.

143.speaker: Player
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

111.speaker: Astarion
111.text: Wait - I'm sorry. You caught me by surprise, that's all.

203.speaker: Astarion
203.text: I've been tracing the scars on my back with my fingers, trying to read them by touch, but I can't. They may as well be written in Rashemi.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: Good. This is personal and we're travelling companions, not friends.

100.speaker: Player
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

195.speaker: Astarion
195.text: I - well, if you must know, I've been trying to make out the scars on my back.

144.speaker: Astarion
144.text: I can't see them, so I've been trying to feel my way about, but they may as well be written in Rashemi.

231.speaker: Astarion
231.text: I was minding my own business. If only everyone was so considerate.

89.speaker: Astarion
89.text: Listen, we travel together, but we're not friends. I'm not about to share anything with someone I can't trust.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I was hoping to hear a little poetry. What's it say?
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

129.speaker: Player
129.text: I know. Now shut up and turn around.

95.speaker: Astarion
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

192.speaker: Player

8.speaker: Player

8.context: NodeContext: The player's walking away when you secretly wanted their help

242.speaker: Astarion
242.context: NodeContext: The player's walking away when you secretly wanted their help

245.speaker: Player
245.text: Want me to get a mirror?

108.speaker: Astarion
108.context: NodeContext: Player just asked if you want a mirror. You're not impressed. (Maybe rubbing your temples for some 'I can't believe you just said that' body language)

106.speaker: Astarion
106.text: I can't read it with a mirror and it seems I can't read it with my hands either.
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Smile and say nothing, waiting for him to speak.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

155.speaker: Astarion
155.text: So... I was wondering if maybe - perhaps - you might be able to...
155.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

80.speaker: Astarion
80.text: Can you read what's on my damned back? Please.
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

125.speaker: Player

52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

196.speaker: Astarion
196.text: It's a sonnet about minding your own damn business.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: Those runes look occult. I can probably read them, if you like?

126.text: I - I suppose it couldn't hurt.

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: I - I suppose it couldn't hurt.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: You can let me look or spend all night twisting yourself into knots. Your call.

63.text: It's my back. My skin. My business.

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: It's my back. My skin. My business.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: Look past the bluster and try to discern his true feelings.

145.speaker: Narrator
145.text: *He might be sneering, but you can see pain in his eyes. He needs help, but doesn't know how to ask.*

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *He might be sneering, but you can see pain in his eyes. He needs help, but doesn't know how to ask.*

137.text: *You examine his face, but all you can see are sneering fangs. His defences are up and you're not getting past them.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *You examine his face, but all you can see are sneering fangs. His defences are up and you're not getting past them.*

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: I don't need help. And certainly not from you.

169.speaker: Astarion
169.text: Now, if you don't mind - piss off.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Just looking. What's that on your back?

65.speaker: Player
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.

175.speaker: Player
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: Oh, it's you. Well, I'm glad you like them.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.

249.speaker: Astarion
249.text: A gift from Cazador, written in flesh. I think it says 'mind your own damn business'.

120.speaker: Astarion
120.text: A gift from Cazador, written in flesh. Apparently it's a poem, but I've never read it.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I thought you didn't care what Cazador wrote on your back.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: Ah! There you are. I admit, I got curious.
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.

252.speaker: Astarion
252.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. He's not happy to see you.

257.speaker: Astarion
257.text: I admit, I was curious, but it's hardly your concern. I'm happy to do this alone.

235.speaker: Astarion
235.text: I - F - or is it an E? Is it even a letter?
235.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing away from you, trying to trace runes on his back with his fingers.InternalNodeContext: Astarion didn't find out it was Infernal during the romance sceneNodeContext: Facing away from you, trying to trace runes on his back with his fingers.

122.speaker: Astarion
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing away from you.NodeContext: Emphasis on 'is'. Facing away from you.

190.speaker: Player
190.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. Full line - "What are you doing here?"

198.speaker: Astarion
198.text: Ah! What the hells are you - wait, did you say Infernal?
198.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. Full line - "What are you doing here?"

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Yes, I can read it if you turn around.
16.context: NodeContext: A little reluctant, he feels uncomfortably vulnerable

162.speaker: Player
162.context: NodeContext: A little reluctant, he feels uncomfortably vulnerable

119.speaker: Astarion
119.text: But you can read it? You can tell me what it says?

152.speaker: Astarion
152.text: Never mind. It's not your concern.

238.speaker: Player
238.context: NodeContext: A little reluctant, he feels uncomfortably vulnerable

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Don't ask me, it's your body...
45.context: NodeContext: A little reluctant, he feels uncomfortably vulnerable

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: Yes, but you can read it? You can tell me what it says?
9.context: NodeContext: A little reluctant, he feels uncomfortably vulnerable

99.speaker: Player
99.context: NodeContext: A little reluctant, he feels uncomfortably vulnerable

23.speaker: Astarion
23.context: NodeContext: A little reluctant, he feels uncomfortably vulnerable

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Oh no, I'm not getting involved.

254.speaker: Astarion
254.text: Of course not. Why would I expect anything else?

226.speaker: Astarion
226.text: Still, you're not the only person in the world that can read Infernal. I'll do this on my own. As I always do.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: Very true. This is nothing to concern yourself with.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: It's easy for some of us.
4.context: NodeContext: Not angry, but a little miffed. Referring to when Raphael magicked away your shirt before.

93.speaker: Astarion
93.text: Did you not get enough of an eyeful back with Raphael?
93.context: NodeContext: Not angry, but a little miffed. Referring to when Raphael magicked away your shirt before.

176.speaker: Astarion
176.text: Although I've been able to make out exactly none of this on my own...

248.speaker: Player
248.text: Want me to take a look?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Trying to decode the scars before Raphael does?

224.speaker: Astarion
224.text: I thought maybe if I could read them myself, we wouldn't have to play whatever game that devil's concocting, but it's no use.

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: I do hate that he just... revealed everything to you, by the way. I would have liked to tell you in my own time.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: But now that I know, why not let me take a look? I can read Infernal, after all.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: But now that I know, let me help you read it.

209.speaker: Player
209.text: How much of it have you read?

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Oh, and when were you going to tell me?

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: I'm not one to drop my guard and trust the first person who flounces up to me after we crash out of the sky.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Well I know now, so why not show me? I can read Infernal, after all.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: Well I know now, so let me help you read it.

256.speaker: Astarion
256.text: I'll know soon enough. The devil will deliver, once the price is right.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: How do you know it's Infernal?

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: I've been wearing these scars for so many years, I started to feel around back there. Try to figure out what poem Cazador cut into me.

225.speaker: Astarion
225.text: I couldn't make out much the first time I tried, but I recognised that jagged Hells-script. Hence, approaching Raphael.
